OPINION
BURKE, Acting C.J.
We are confronted here with the question whether the current practice of allowing non-attorney judges to preside over criminal trials of offenses punishable by a jail sentence, as is the situation in over *326 60 percent of the justice courts in California, violates the constitutional rights of the defendants in those proceedings.
